title: Dogecoin Proves It's a Serious Blockchain, Flips Ethereum Transaction Count - Blockworks
summary: Dogecoin has surged in network activity, processing more transactions than Ethereum in the past week. The memecoin network handled over 7.9 million transactions, while Ethereum handled around 7.2 million. This is despite Dogecoin's average daily transactions being less than 5% of Ethereum's. The increase in activity is due to the use of Bitcoin Ordinals, which are inscribed with data to create unique digital assets. However, the lack of a standard for Dogecoin tokens means that many are being minted under the same name, making it difficult to form a legitimate market around them. Despite this, the median transaction value on Dogecoin is still higher than on Ethereum, and the blockchain has historically served as a lucrative alternative for bitcoin miners during unprofitable times.

title: What Is Solidity Programming in Ethereum - Simplilearn
summary: Solidity is a programming language used to create smart contracts on the Ethereum blockchain. It's a new language developed by the Ethereum Network team and is used to create decentralized applications (DApps) on the Ethereum platform. Solidity is similar to C and C++ and has features like variables, functions, classes, and more. It's used to create machine-level code that can be executed on the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM). Solidity programming has advantages like type safety and natural language specification, and it's used to create complex data types and member variables. To get started with Solidity programming, you can use the version pragma to specify the compiler version, declare state variables, and declare functions.

title: What Is Ethereum 2.0? What You Should Know - GOBankingRates
summary: Ethereum is upgrading its technology to Ethereum 2.0, which includes three core steps: the Beacon Chain, the Ethereum Merge, and Ethereum Sharding (now replaced by layer 2 rollups). The Beacon Chain was a test for the proof-of-stake (PoS) mechanism, while the Ethereum Merge combined the blockchain data collected since Ethereum's inception with the data collected on the Beacon Chain. The goal is to make the network more scalable, secure, and sustainable. The upgrades have reduced Ethereum's energy consumption by 99.95%. Ethereum is now breaking its roadmap into four categories: cheaper transactions, extra security, better user experience, and future proofing. The upgrades have also raised questions about whether Ethereum 2.0 will be a new coin, if Ethereum holders need to take any action, and if the upgrades will reduce gas fees. title: Ethereum, Bitcoin Balances on Exchanges Edges Toward 5-Year Low - Decrypt
summary:
Here is a summary of the financial news in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum balances on centralized exchanges have hit a five-year low, with 17.8 million ETH representing 14.85% of the network's total token supply. This is significantly less than the peak value of 30% reached in 2020. The decline in Ethereum balances may be due to investors moving their holdings to stake the cryptocurrency, as the amount of staked ETH surged after the Shapella upgrade. Similarly, Bitcoin's exchange balance dropped to levels not seen since March 2018, with a significant portion of the decline coming after the FTX collapse.

title: VISA Explores the Potential of Smart Contracts for Payments with Ethereum - ZyCrypto
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

VISA is exploring the potential of smart contracts for payments on the Ethereum blockchain. The company has deployed two paymaster contracts on the Ethereum Goerli testnet to investigate ways to redesign gas fees and improve user convenience. VISA is also studying ERC-4337, a proposal for digital payments that adds the ability for smart contracts to transact on behalf of the user. The company aims to eliminate the need for users to accumulate different native blockchain tokens solely for paying gas fees. With the implementation of ERC-4337 and smart contract wallets, payments and wallet security are expected to improve significantly, leading to wider adoption of cryptocurrencies.

title: Bitcoin Emerges as Second-Largest NFT Blockchain, Challenging Ethereum’s Dominance - NFT Culture
summary: Bitcoin is gaining ground as a leading NFT blockchain, challenging Ethereum's dominance. Bitcoin's NFT sales volume has surged to $169 million in the past month, with various collections and brands finding success on the blockchain. Although Ethereum still leads with $393 million, Bitcoin's popularity is growing rapidly. The success of Bitcoin's Ordinals protocol, which assigns serial numbers to individual satoshis, has driven transaction fees to miners and opened up possibilities for DeFi, tokenization, and experimentation on the blockchain. While Ethereum has 38 million NFT transactions since inception, Bitcoin's growing popularity and innovative use of Ordinals suggest it could overtake Ethereum as the leading NFT blockchain.

title: Ethereum L2s Are About to Be the Hot New Thing in NFTs - Unchained - Unchained
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the financial news in less than 256 tokens:

Episode 498 of Unchained features Luke Miles, co-founder of mint.fun, a platform aiming to make NFTs more discoverable, accessible, and fun. Miles discusses emerging trends in the NFT space, including the rise of Ethereum L2s as NFT hot spots, and why mint.fun is launching on these platforms. He also shares his thoughts on the current state of the NFT market and the shift from PFP projects to the "single creator narrative." Additionally, Miles discusses the difference between open-edition and limited edition NFTs, and why he believes NFTs on layer 2s are "about to have a moment." Finally, he addresses whether mint.fun will launch on other blockchains and offers his thoughts on Ordinals and the BRC-20 mania.

title: a16z releases anonymous voting system for Ethereum - Cointelegraph
summary: Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) has released a Solidity library called Cicada for anonymous voting on Ethereum. Cicada prevents individual voters' choices from being known before polling ends and can make voters' identities permanently unknowable when combined with zero-knowledge group membership systems. The library relies on homomorphic time-lock puzzles, which allow users to encrypt secret values that can only be decrypted after a specific period of time has passed. These puzzles were proposed in 2019 and allow votes to be counted even if users go offline. However, Cicada requires voters to submit a zero-knowledge proof of ballot validity to prevent attackers from increasing their voting power by incorrectly encoding their votes. The library only prevents votes from being known while the poll is open, and once the poll has closed or the time-lock period has passed, anyone can determine the contents of a vote by brute-forcing the solution to the puzzle. Combining Cicada with zero-knowledge group membership systems can solve the problem of brute-forcing the puzzle and reveal only that the vote was cast by an eligible voter without

title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Hold Ground as $3.5 Billion in Options Expire - Decrypt
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum have held steady despite a $3.5 billion options expiration today. The leading cryptocurrencies rose 1% and 1.6% respectively, with Bitcoin trading at $26,509 and Ethereum at $1,800. The options market had a put-to-call ratio of 0.44 for Bitcoin and every put option had two call open options opened for Ethereum, indicating bullish positions. However, low liquidity in the market may lead to increased volatility in the near term.

title: Will Solana's Metaplex Fees Push Developers Back to Ethereum? - Blockworks
summary: Metaplex, a dominant NFT protocol on the Solana blockchain, introduced network fees for NFT creators and developers, sparking backlash and concerns about the impact on development. Despite initial plans to remove some of the proposed fees, the company remains committed to covering costs through fees, which could hinder NFT development on Solana and attract developers back to Ethereum. The fees are intended to fund development on the Metaplex standard and other programs, but some in the community are concerned about the impact on public goods and the potential for taxation without proper communication. The introduction of fees has raised questions about the balance between fast development and proper funding, with some arguing that Ethereum's slower pace of development allows for more thoughtful and sustainable innovation.

title: “Cardano Will Be More Decentralized Than All Crypto”: Charles Hoskinson on Summer Expectations - DailyCoin
summary: Cardano founder Charles Hoskinson has announced that the network will be more decentralized than all other cryptocurrencies by summer, including Bitcoin and Ethereum. The development team is working on a groundbreaking revision of Cardano's on-chain governance infrastructure, CIP-1694, which will allow any user to submit a governance action. The network is also conducting workshops worldwide to educate the community on the new protocol. Hoskinson believes that once CIP-1694 is integrated and a community vote is held, Cardano will become more decentralized than all other cryptocurrencies. Additionally, the development team is working on measuring and quantifying decentralization using the Edinburgh Decentralization Index, which could help regulatory bodies formulate informed regulations.
